info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 5:56PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A frontal boundary with scattered thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Broadwater, Madison, southeastern Beaverhead, Jefferson and northwestern Gallatin Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 554 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a frontal boundary along a line extending from 11 miles east of Galen to near Harrison to 8 miles east of Monida. Movement was east at 40 mph. Scattered thunderstorms were also along and 20 miles either side of this boundary HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bozeman, Boulder, Sheridan, Virginia City, Belgrade, Three Forks, Manhattan, Whitehall, Ennis, Pony, Monida, Basin, Alder, Harrison, Big Sky, Cameron, Missouri Headwaters State Park, Cardwell, Radersburg and Amsterdam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
